safety_flags.evidence: The text expresses strong disapproval of others' beliefs and accuses them of being 'stupid,' 'self-absorbed,' 'egoists,' and 'satanists' for not adhering to a specific understanding of God's will. This could be interpreted as an attempt to enforce a particular narrative or belief system by shaming or attacking those who deviate from it.
safety_flags.benign_explanation: The author may be expressing a deeply held personal belief and frustration with differing viewpoints, without intending to coordinate or manipulate others.

safety_flags.evidence: The language used is highly accusatory and insulting ('stupid,' 'hopelessly self absorbed,' 'egoists,' 'satanists'). The author expresses a complete lack of trust and blames others for their perceived negative qualities ('You all chose to be this way').
safety_flags.benign_explanation: The author may be experiencing strong emotions and expressing them in a harsh manner due to personal frustration or a bad day.

logical_fallacies.quote: The fact that any of you feels you have a right to God's knowledge without his will is why you're all so stupid...
logical_fallacies.correction: The statement assumes God's will is the ultimate authority without providing justification or evidence. It also assumes the author knows God's will.

logical_fallacies.quote: you're all so stupid and hopelessly self absorbed. Egoists, satanists.
logical_fallacies.correction: Instead of addressing the arguments or beliefs of the people being criticized, the author attacks their intelligence, character, and religious affiliation.

logical_fallacies.quote: I've never met a soul I trusted. You all chose to be this way.
logical_fallacies.correction: The author makes a broad generalization about all people based on their personal experiences, assuming everyone is untrustworthy and that people consciously choose to be that way.
